data.title: British musical fantasy films
data.text:
3.

Labyrinth

1986 film by Jim Henson

Overview: Labyrinth is a 1986 musical fantasy film directed by Jim Henson, with George Lucas as executive producer, based upon conceptual designs by Brian Froud. It revolves around 16-year-old Sarah's (Jennifer ...

Release date: 27 June 1986

Genre: Adventure, Family, Fantasy, Musical

Director: Jim Henson

Sixteen-year-old Sarah is given thirteen hours to solve a labyrinth and rescue her baby brother Toby when her wish for him to be taken away is granted ...

Overview: Corpse Bride (also known as Tim Burton's Corpse Bride) is a 2005 stop-motion animated musical fantasy film directed by Mike Johnson and Tim Burton with a screenplay by John August, Caroline Thompson and ...

Release date: 7 September 2005

Genre: Animation, Comedy, Fantasy, Music, Romance, Musical

When a shy groom practices his wedding vows in the inadvertent presence of a deceased young woman, she rises from the grave assuming he has married her ...

Scrooge

1970 film by Ronald Neame

Overview: Scrooge is a 1970 British musical film adaptation of Charles Dickens' 1843 story A Christmas Carol. It was filmed in London between January and May 1970 and directed by Ronald Neame, and starred Albert ...

Release date: 5 November 1970

Genre: Drama, Musical, Fantasy, Family, Romance, Thriller

Director: Ronald Neame

Tommy

1975 British film

Overview: Tommy is a 1975 British satirical operetta fantasy drama film written and directed by Ken Russell and based upon The Who's 1969 rock opera album Tommy about a "psychosomatically deaf, mute, and blind" ...

Release date: 19 March 1975

Genre: Drama, Musical, Fantasy

Director: Ken Russell

A psychosomatically blind, deaf, and mute boy becomes a master pinball player and, subsequently, the figurehead of a cult.

Overview: Rock-a-Doodle is a 1991 live-action/animated musical comedy produced by Sullivan Bluth Studios and Goldcrest Films. Loosely based on Edmond Rostand's 1910 comedy play Chantecler, Rock-a-Doodle was directed ...

9.

The Nutcracker: The Untold Story

2010 musical fantasy film by Andrei Konchalovsky

Overview: The Nutcracker in 3D (released on DVD as The Nutcracker: The Untold Story) is a 2010 British-Hungarian 3D Christmas musical fantasy thriller film adapted from the ballet The Nutcracker. Co-written, di ...

Release date: 5 February 2009

Genre: Fantasy, Action, Family, Musical

Director: Andrey Konchalovskiy

In 1920s Vienna, a young girl receives a magical doll on Christmas Eve.

Cats

2019 film directed by Tom Hooper

Overview: Cats is a 2019 musical fantasy film based on the 1981 Tony Award-winning stage musical of the same name by Andrew Lloyd Webber, which in turn was based on the poetry collection Old Possum's Book of Pr ...

Release date: 20 December 2019

Director: Tom Hooper

A tribe of cats called the Jellicles must decide yearly which one will ascend to the Heaviside Layer and come back to a new Jellicle life.

Release date: 4 April 1951

Genre: Romance, Music, Fantasy, Adventure

Overview: Wonka is a 2023 musical fantasy film directed by Paul King, who co-wrote the screenplay with Simon Farnaby based on a story by King. It tells the origin story of Willy Wonka, a character in the 1964 novel ...

Release date: 17 March 2023

Director: Paul King

With dreams of opening a shop in a city renowned for its chocolate, a young and poor Willy Wonka discovers that the industry is run by a cartel of greedy ...

Wombling Free

1977 British film adaptation of The Wombles

Overview: Wombling Free is a 1977 British film adaptation of the children's television series The Wombles. Directed by Lionel Jeffries, it stars The Wombles, David Tomlinson, Frances de la Tour, and Bonnie Langford ...

Director: Lionel Jeffries

Maximum Shame

2010 British film

Overview: Maximum Shame is a feature-length dystopian movie, written and directed by Carlos Atanes and released in 2010.

Release date: 1 July 2010

Genre: Fantasy, Horror, Musical, Sci-Fi

Director: Carlos Atanes
